reviews.review_msg: I agree with others that she definitely likes to make you feel like you will never be as smart as her. Not a very motivating or approachable instructor. Her lectures are also boring to sit through. Im not sure why she assigns a textbook when she doesnt use it at all except for the tables in the back. Take it with someone else if you can.

Expect lengthy, detailed handouts, which Kate has designed to help you succeed (they contain everything you need to know). You can also expect detailed lectures for which you should be prepared to write fast. Kate also tells you EXACTLY what to study to do well on the midterm and final. Overall: a wise, excellent prof teaching a challenging course.
Not approachable and likes to make students feel stupid.

I didn't enjoy this class, not because it's statistics, but because Dr. Slaney was unapproachable and seemed to have little interest in helping the students. Her idea of "teaching" is to just stand in one spot and talk at you.

She's alrighh, but her lectures are just so dry and boring. Seems like she's just feeding you rehearsed lines and isn't very approachable. She gets upset when you point out mistakes in her notes and is very defensive. Makes students pay for a very expensive textbook and doesn't even use it.

quite helpful, passionate, has clear expectations. marking was a bit slow but understandable. make sure to take notes during lec. expect a lot of writing. some people think it's boring as she really goes into a lot of detail and repeats herself a lot but i liked it, was like storytelling. philosophy of science handout important!

Much of the blame goes to the course itself. However, lecture delivery is poor. The lecture slides have very few points on them... And she talks too muchfast, making it difficult to make notes. They marking takes forever... The first assignment was graded like 3-4 weeks later.

Talks pretty fast, assignments are quite difficult, and too much information to know for exams - honestly, quite a difficult course if you've already got a heavy course load and other difficult courses. The content is boring, and she just makes it worse.
Passionate about teaching, Kate does not give grades away.   An A means outstanding work, not average work.  Get on board, this is a major university and not all students are "A" students.

The content of this course is pretty drydull and attending is a must bc there is participation grade and you will NOT do well if you don't attend - taking notes is a must. There is plenty of help from the prof and the TA I had was a huge help too. You can do well if you put the effort in - but it may be more effort than you're willing to put in

Kate definitely packs a lot of info into her lectures, and her exams / assignments require critical thinking not just memorization. A lot of her assignments / exam questions are framed as "synthesis" Qs - how different ideas/people/perspectives relate or contrast with others. So be prepared to make some charts.

Her lectures are brutal,if you ever want to know every tiny minuscule unimportant detail of the history of psychology, then hear it five times over take this class. Listening to them again for the final made me want to rip my hair out. If she could make her point without explaining the meaning of every word she uses, she would be an awesome prof
Great course and very challenging as a university course should be. Lots of handouts used to help with book costs...very helpfull.

Definitely a challenging course, make sure you are prepared to put in the work before you take it. Notes are a bit long, but I'm glad to have them for reference. Exams were fair, make sure you define EVERYTHING. Assignments were picky but really allow you to apply your knowledge. She's an effective communicator and is really helpful in office hours

This is an intermediate stats course to prep Honours students, and if you are not prepared to *gasp* put in some actual work, then don't take this class. Kate wants you to understand the material and that's why she posts such comprehensive notes. Be familiar with the material before class to know where you're lacking and you will be fine.

She's great. She puts a tonne of effort into teaching, she makes the subject interesting (and for something that's not super interesting by itself, that's a feat), and she makes herself super available. She has high expectations--it's not easy--but she wants her students to succeed, and will commit herself to helping you understand, if you ask

Slaney is insane. She will bury you in an avalanche of work. She likes to give 20 page handouts (posted hours before her lectures) which you are supposed to magically memorize before the lecture.  If you take a class with her, I recommend the following: quit your job, drop all your other classes, and MAYBE you will pass. Or die trying.
I just took her Summer Intersession for this class.                                 She is very good.

Hard job to teach a History course, especially when so few people actually care/are interested.  Lectures are thorough, material is... plentiful, but seriously, if you actually nose into it and go get help when you need it, you'll do fine.  She has high expectations - not the least of which being that you work for your grades...

Her class was great, wonderful, and enjoyable.  Very well thought out lectures that are very precise yet fully explained.  To those who disagree, if you REALLY listened during lecture, you would know I am right.

A lot to cover in the course  and the philosophy of science concepts are hard to get your head  around... but Slaney was always available for help and made sure to clarify things on webct discussions throughout the semester. Her course is writing intensive (total of 10+ essays) and you will have to put in work to get a good grade. Textbook optional

Stats for psychology. Extremely difficult course, but Kate made it much less frustrating than I thought it would be. Made the material accessible (as much as is possible given the content). Only complaint: assignments were too long (27 pages for one question!). I don't know what all the haters are talking about; Kate Slaney's a great prof.

Quite rude, condescending, and unhelpful. Lots of definitions and names to remember. I have never found any of the material I learned in this class helpful for any of my future courses. She should test concepts more than rote memory but does not. I would recommend you avoid this class but you cannot if you want a Psyc major. Good luck!

A lot of not so thrilling material in this course.  She did a great job of keeping the lectures interesting and had great knowledge about the subject.  She made herself available after class and it was very helpful going to see her.  Great prof, alright class... study a lot!

She tried her best to make the stuff less boring. As long as you work hard, you will get pretty high mark onb them. The mid term is hard bcuz you have to memorize all the definitions. However, she promised she will not do this agian on final.

horrible class!!! had a neutral opinion going into the class and it became brutal. Very nice person, but prob one of the worst teachers ive had in crim...assumes you know certain concepts..reads notes..goes over things fast. A bonus is that her lectures are recorded. wouldn't recommend this course or prof
she is okay but there is too much to read

This class is useless you don't learn anything all you do is absorb all the defintions that are thrown at you,once that is done with u forget all of them so what is really the point of taking this class. The exam is to much,you have to study the vocab words and also essay questions(3of them.You have to study like u've never studied b4 in this class

Probably the worst in the dept. She knows we have to take her class to get a psyc BA, so she thinks she can get away with being pretentious and rude. Notes are confusing on purpose, must be very hard for ESL students! Rude to everyone. Impossible to listen to her or to 'decode' lecture notes. Gives extra work just for fun & only marks part of it!

I think that she can be quite rude, harsh and doesn't really seem to want to be there, but I think her teaching ability is ok,she knows the material well, and her exam was very fair. It's hard to make this stuff interesting, but I think she does not a bad job. I guess she could just be a little warmer.

also, two of the questions on the midterm were basically identical to the questions that were in assignment 2, so you should've already known how to answer those. i agree that the material is boring, although i have hope for the second half of the course. you get what you put into the course. the midterm honestly was not as bad as people make it ou

so i've changed my opinion of this class since the midterm, for the better actually. reading other people's comments on here had me worried, but the midterm was not that hard at all, i did better than i expected, i mean she gives you the essay question in advance. what are you all whining about? you don't even need to read the textbook

Entertaining? Are you having a wack attack? I find it literally painfully difficult to be entertained by a professor who READS her lectures from a pile of notes. Also don't rely on the TEXT BOOK of all things to answer the written assignments, you're setting yourself up for failure. Avoid this prof - if that's what you wanna call her.

When I took her class, the class average for the midterm was something like 30%! Most people in the class did horribly! Her ability to teach is mediocre, but it's the difficult exams that really mess you up! I don't know if she's better now, but I would definitely not take a class with her again EVER!!

Honestly, I don't know why people complained so much about her. I took this class in the fall of 2006, and basically you just had to memorize the notes, you did not have to know the text. The reason why so many people complained I guess was cuz it was a lot of notes but what do you expect from a history class?

I went in to this class with the lowest of expectations, but finished this course with a fairly positive impression of the prof. The midterm and final are crazy difficult, but she managed expectations better this semester by essentially saying she marks on a curve. What also surprised me is that she is an excellent speaker. Clear and entertaining.

This woman is a real piece of work!! She's grumpy, pretentious, and pety. In all my years of education I've never encountered such lack of professionalism. I'd sooner be taught psychology by a group of sem-retarded monkeys rather than sit through another one of her classes.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!

all i can say this professor is not professional at all.  she does not care how much you understanding.  she only knows non-stop talking as fast as she can to go through all the materials.  she was thinking not to record lecture from the beginning, but, dep force her to. (lots of people throwing their pencils and drop off the class on the 1st day

Very difficult and frustrating course. Over 200 definitions to memorize and know the person or school associated with them for the exam as well as three essays to practice before the final and 70 multiple choice questions. Crazy! Really low average. Not very friendly, helpful or understanding.

Dr.Slaney was very knowledgeable about this subject, however tried to teach us WAY too much information with way too much detail, especially for a 2nd year course. If you want to learn how to work your ass off take this course however don't expect to do above average, and be prepared to study like you never have B4. VERY hard exams, but easy paper.
if u want to fail the course, take her; if u want to feel frustrated, take her;  if u want to waste money, take her, if u don't want to graduate, take her. I never seen such a ... prof like her.
Just plain rude to the students.  What's the point in that?

Like someone said above, exam average was 50%.  She likes to read paragraphs of information during lecture instead of focusing on trying to teach you what you need to know for the course.  Maybe it's just cause I don't like history courses.
what does it tell you when the average on the midterm is 50%?  brutal.
Her exam seemed to be pretty hard.  At the end of the exam, I expected her to come out dressed as Gandalf and yell "YOU SHALL NOT PASS".
Her exams are not too hard if you have a good memory and be able to express all the material she has covered in class.
